title: Domestic Relations Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Senate/ received bill from Legislative Research in Waiting for Introduction in the Senate
Senate/ 1st reading (Introduced) in Senate Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to domestic relations.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions for, and the use of, "parent" and "natural parent" throughout the Utah Code to reflect the definition of a parent-child relationship under Title 81, Chapter 5, Uniform Parentage Act;<hr><ltbullet>creates definitions related to the definition of "parent";<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Recovery Services to review the requirements for calculating a minimal child support award for a child support order and to report to the Judiciary Interim Committee regarding the review;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies language regarding the parent-child relationship for purposes of intestate succession;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the district court of each judicial district assign any case or proceeding involving the same child or family to a single judge;<hr><ltbullet>requires at least one party to a marriage to be physically present in the state at the time of the marriage;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a marriage solemnized on or after May 6, 2026, is prohibited and void if:<hr><ltbullet1>the marriage is solemnized remotely through electronic means;<hr><ltbullet1>both individuals marrying are not residents of the state; and<hr><ltbullet1>the individuals marrying are not located in the same location in the state when the marriage is solemnized;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a man is not presumed to be the father of a child in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the authority of a court to deny a motion for genetic testing, or disregard genetic test results, in a parentage proceeding;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to child support;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for child care expenses in a child support order, including the requirements for a minimal child care award;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the base child support award is automatically adjusted for the remaining children in the child support order when parental rights to a child are terminated for the parent who is obligated to pay child support;<hr><ltbullet>creates a table for the purposes of establishing a minimal child care award for certain child support orders entered or modified on or after January 1, 2027;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the list of offenses requiring notification when a parent is residing with an individual, or providing an individual with access to the parent's minor child, who has been convicted of an offense;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may not require a parent in a custody and parent-time proceeding to disclose the parent's address if the parent relocated due to domestic violence or family violence by the other parent;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the establishment and modification of a parent-time schedule;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the list of offenses related to when a court may order supervised parent-time;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies, for purposes of modifying custody due to a substantial and material change, the list of offenses for when a parent is residing with an individual, or providing an individual with access to the parent's minor child, and the parent knows that the individual has been convicted of an offense;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a change of custody or parent-time for a minor child who turns five years old;<hr><ltbullet>addresses make-up parent-time when a parent has been denied parent-time due to an investigation by the Division of Child and Family Services;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time requirements upon the relocation of a parent;<hr><ltbullet>addresses telephone contact and virtual parent-time for a noncustodial parent when a parent relocates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the time periods for extended parent-time by a parent for summer break or off-track time to be consecutive;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time schedules to address consistency issues;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time schedules for Mother's Day and Father's Day;<hr><ltbullet>removes Columbus Day and Veterans Day as holidays in the parent-time schedules;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the list of offenses regarding when a court cannot grant custody to an individual who is convicted, pleads guilty, or pleads no contest to an offense; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming corrections.

action_history.description: Senate/ received bill from Legislative Research
action_history.owner: Waiting for Introduction in the Senate
